.
Example:  Award Adjustments When a Veteran Is Reunited With Dependent(s)
Scenario
:
VA has been paying disability compensation to an incarcerated Veteran at the rate payable under
38 CFR 3.665(d)(1)
for several years, based on an SC disability VA rated 50-percent disabling.
The Veteran has a spouse and one child to whom VA granted an apportionment in the amount of $700.00 per month as a result of the Veteran’s incarceration.
On February 3, 2022, VA received notice the Veteran had been released from prison on January 21, 2022.
The Veteran was reunited with his spouse and child, and they reside at the same address.
VA last paid the apportionment to the Veteran’s spouse for the month of January 2022.
Actions
:
Discontinue the apportionment effective February 1, 2022.
Amend the Veteran’s award to pay
$418.44 from January 21, 2022 (This represents the difference between the rate payable for a 50-percent disabled Veteran with a spouse and one child ($1,118.44) and the amount of the apportionment.), and
$1,118.44 from February 1, 2022.
Notify the Veteran and his spouse of the adjustments made to their individual awards.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B - Paying Benefits to the Dependent(s) of an Incarcerated Veteran
citation: Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B
